conclusion: Analyze the flow direction and placement of baffles to determine which container liquid will flow into.
The liquid flows from top to bottom in the image.
Baffles A, B, and C are placed horizontally across the flow path.
Baffle A is positioned above the liquid flow, so it will redirect the flow downward.
Baffle B is also positioned above the liquid flow, redirecting it further downward.
Baffle C is positioned above the liquid flow, redirecting it again downward.
Container D is located below the baffles A, B, and C.
Container E is also located below the baffles A, B, and C but is positioned slightly to the right of container D.
Since the baffles are horizontal and redirect the flow downward, the liquid will continue to flow downward after passing through each baffle.
After passing through all three baffles, the liquid will reach the containers below them.

Given that both containers D and E are directly below the baffles and there is no indication of any branching or additional baffles between them, the liquid will flow into the first container it encounters.
Since container D is positioned to the left of container E, the liquid will flow into container D before reaching container E.
The liquid will flow into container D after passing through baffles A, B, and C.
